definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: His narrative is a super rendering of dialect speech and idiom.
sentences.chinese: 他的敘述是方言和土語最成功的運用。

sentences.english: Already almost all Californian Native American languages are in danger of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎所有加州當地的美洲土語已有消失之虞。

sentences.english: We've passed through a century during which many indigenous languages were wiped out or pushed to the brink of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 幾世紀來，許多土語遭到抹殺或是一夕之間消失。

sentences.english: I did; but they were uttered in the Romaic dialect.
sentences.chinese: 聽到的，但他們說的是羅馬土語。

sentences.english: They can always write their local languages in the Roman characters.
sentences.chinese: 他們大可用羅馬字母來書寫他們的土語。

sentences.english: This is a very typical local language.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種非常典型的地方土語。

sentences.english: The creatures take their scientific name from the word for 'root' in the local Afar language.
sentences.chinese: 其科學名稱來自當地土語Afar中的“根”這個詞。

sentences.english: This article mainly discussed about the impact of Chinese loan words Ordos dialect.
sentences.chinese: 本論文概述了鄂爾多斯土語中的漢語藉詞情況。

definition: marginalized people (not part of mainstream society)/marginal man (term coined by social psychologist Kurt Lewin, referring to a person in transition between two cultures or social groups, not fully belonging to either)
Dugu Qiubai, a fictional character appearing in 金庸[Jin1 Yong1] novels
